title: How to Make a Chocolate Banana Milkshake

methods.name: Making a Basic Chocolate Banana Milkshake

steps.headline: Peel and slice a banana, and place it into a blender.
steps.description: This will make it easier to mix in and give you a smoother milkshake in the end. If you'd like your milkshakes extra thick, use a frozen banana instead.

steps.headline: Add 1 cup (144 grams) of ice cream.
steps.description: You can use vanilla ice cream for a less-intense flavor, or chocolate ice cream for a more intense flavor.

steps.headline: Pour in ¾ cup (180 milliliters) of milk.
steps.description: You can use any type of milk, but whole milk will give you a richer-tasting milkshake. If you like your milkshakes on the thin side, use up to 1 cup (240 milliliters) of milk. If you like your milkshakes on the thicker side, use only 1/3 cup (80 milliliters) of milk.

steps.headline: Add 2 to 5 tablespoons of chocolate syrup.
steps.description: If you used vanilla ice cream, you may want to use up to 5 tablespoons of chocolate syrup. If you are using chocolate ice cream, you might want to use only 2 tablespoons so as not to overwhelm the banana flavor. For extra flavor, add 1 tablespoon of smooth peanut butter.

steps.headline: Close the blender, and blend until everything is smooth and evenly combined.
steps.description: There should be no lumps, clumps, streaks, or swirls. If the milkshake isn't blending smoothly enough, pause the blender, and use a spatula to scrape the ingredients down the sides. If you'd like some extra crunch, ad ¼ cup (45 grams) of mini chocolate chips in the last few seconds of blending.

steps.headline: Serve the milkshake.
steps.description: Pour the milkshake into one or two tall glasses and add a straw. If you'd like, you can garnish it with a swirl of whipped cream, some chocolate sauce, or chocolate curls.

methods.name: Making a Vegan Chocolate Banana Milkshake

steps.headline: Add one frozen banana, peeled and sliced, into a blender.
steps.description: If you'd like a thinner milkshake, you can use a regular, non-frozen banana. Cutting the banana before adding it to the blender will make it easier to mix together and give you a smoother drink in the end. Using frozen bananas is highly recommended. They will replace the ice cream in the milkshake.

steps.headline: Add 1½ tablespoons of unsweetened cacao powder.
steps.description: Try to get the kind used for baking. It is pure cacao and does not contain any dairy.

steps.headline: Add the almond butter.
steps.description: If you really don't like the taste of almonds, you can use peanut butter instead, or omit it entirely.

steps.headline: Pour in 1/3 cup (80 milliliters) of unsweetened almond milk.
steps.description: You can use the plain kind or the vanilla flavored kind. For a twist, you could even try coconut milk instead! For an even thicker milkshake, add in some ice cubes or frozen almond milk.

steps.headline: Close the blender, and blend until smooth.
steps.description: Everything should be evenly combined, with no lumps, clumps, streaks or swirls. If your ingredients are not blending smoothly, pause the blender, and use a spatula to scrape the chunky mixture down the sides. For extra crunch and chocolate-y flavor, add ¼ cup (45 grams) of mini baking chocolate chips. They are typically dairy-free, but check the label to make sure.

steps.headline: Serve the milkshake.
steps.description: Pour it into a tall glass and serve it with a straw. For extra flavor, you could add a sprinkle of cinnamon or cacao powder on top.
